str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A handkerchief, napkin. Of Latin origin; a sudarium, i.e. Towel.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To wrap up, roll round, envelop. From en and tulisso; to entwine, i.e. Wind up in.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A linen bandage, a wrapping. Neuter of a presumed derivative of othone; a linen bandage.
